abstract.p: Association of National Advertisers, trade organization that represents America's largest marketers, has stopped selling sponsorship of daily general sessions at its annual conference, which this year is scheduled to start on Oct 13 (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: The Association of National Advertisers, the trade organization that represents America's largest marketers, has stopped selling sponsorships of daily general sessions at its annual conference, which this year is scheduled to start on Oct. 13.

Andy Cooper, a spokesman for the association in New York, confirmed a report of the change in Advertising Age this week, adding that the theme of this year's conference, ''Brand Building in the New Economy,'' did not lend itself to participation by general session sponsors. For the last three years, media companies seeking to promote themselves to potential clients at the conference had spent an estimated $100,000 to sponsor the general sessions.
